title: inconvenient "feature": host/clone specifics within meta-data
body:
decided to recrawl a dataset and although there were no changes really, aggregation of metadata resulted in a commit:

```shell
hopa:~/datalad/openfmri/ds000001
$> git show
commit 8539d4f810e2bb8e7f79c9b96f3a0e14543ffde9
Author: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
Date:   Sat Mar 25 09:53:29 2017 -0400

    [DATALAD] aggregated meta data

diff --git a/.datalad/meta/meta.json b/.datalad/meta/meta.json
index eb8b2e3c..415f2591 100644
--- a/.datalad/meta/meta.json
+++ b/.datalad/meta/meta.json
@@ -7,6 +7,10 @@
     "@id": "233cc486-7d0e-11e6-855b-002590f97d84",
     "availableFrom": [
       {
+        "@id": "77012128-0abc-4349-b887-347ee0b33b83",
+        "description": "yoh@hopa:~/datalad/openfmri/ds000001"
+      },
+      {
         "@id": "899f0347-0888-48ef-91b6-bac213ca8cef",
         "description": "[datalad-archives]"
       },
@@ -24,7 +28,7 @@
       },
       {
         "@id": "f4cc85b8-e252-4c4d-9c35-6dc64ce87317",
-        "description": "yoh@falkor:/srv/datasets.datalad.org/www/openfmri/ds000001 [datalad-public]"
+        "description": "yoh@falkor:/srv/datasets.datalad.org/www/openfmri/ds000001 [origin]"
       }
     ],
     "dcterms:conformsTo": "http://docs.datalad.org/metadata.html#v0-1",
```

which becomes kinda a nuisance.  So may be those names of the remotes (and either they are enabled or not) should be stripped while collecting description so there were no "host specific" side effects in meta-data
